dimensions.name: Custom Viewer 1
dimensions.description: Placeholder for a custom dimension that captures data at the viewer level. To edit the dimension name on the Luna Control Center, in `Configure`, go to the report pack tab of the entity selector, select the relevant report pack, and click on the dimension name. This field is only available for use with metrics at the viewer level.

dimensions.name: Continent
dimensions.description: Viewer location. Available granularities are continent, region, country, and city.

dimensions.name: Os
dimensions.description: Operating system of the device on which the media was played.

dimensions.name: Country
dimensions.description: Country from which viewer requested media.

dimensions.name: Device
dimensions.description: Device on which the media was played. For example, mobile phone, tablet, or desktop.

dimensions.name: Region
dimensions.description: Region from which viewer requested media.

dimensions.name: City
dimensions.description: City from which viewer requested media.

dimensions.name: custom_Viewer 2
dimensions.description: Placeholder for a custom dimension that captures data at the viewer level.

dimensions.name: Time
dimensions.description: Time as per time zone specified in the report.

metrics.name: Startup Abandonment Rate
metrics.description: Percentage of plays abandoned by viewers before initial buffer fill.

metrics.name: Plays Completed
metrics.description: Total number of plays that played back at least 95% of content.

metrics.name: Plays with Errors
metrics.description: Total number of play attempts that ended before start of playback due to errors.

metrics.name: Plays with Rebuffers
metrics.description: Sum of plays with at least one rebuffering event.

metrics.name: Play Percentage
metrics.description: Average play percentage of all plays of the media title.

metrics.name: Bitrate
metrics.description: Average bitrate at which media is played back. Samples for calculation are taken at regular time intervals during playback (~500ms).

metrics.name: Completion Percentage
metrics.description: Percentage of plays that played over 95% of the duration of the stream.

metrics.name: Visits
metrics.description: Sum of viewer sessions of media playback activity with more than one title played during the course of a visit.

metrics.name: Availability
metrics.description: Average availability across all attempts (excluding user abandons). Calculated as the number of plays divided by plays + startup errors.

metrics.name: Plays Ended
metrics.description: Plays ended include both completed and abandoned plays. You can plot this metric with the `Rebuffer time per Minute` and `Rebuffers per Minute` dimensions.

metrics.name: Hourly Viewers
metrics.description: Unique viewers for a given hour.

metrics.name: Weekly Viewers
metrics.description: Sum of unique viewers for a given week.

metrics.name: Monthly Viewers
metrics.description: Sum of unique viewers for a given month.

metrics.name: Startup Time
metrics.description: Average startup time per session.

metrics.name: Quarterly Viewers
metrics.description: Sum of unique viewers for a given quarter.

metrics.name: Yearly Viewers
metrics.description: Sum of unique viewers for a given year.

metrics.name: Plays per Viewer (Daily)
metrics.description: Total plays divided by the number of daily viewers.

metrics.name: Visits per Viewer (Daily)
metrics.description: Total visits divided by the number of daily viewers.

metrics.name: Plays per Visit (Play Level)
metrics.description: Total plays divided by the number of visits.

metrics.name: Play Duration per Visit
metrics.description: Total play duration divided by the number of visits.

metrics.name: Peeks
metrics.description: Total number of peeks, plays that last less than 5 seconds.

metrics.name: 24x7 Plays
metrics.description: Sum of first plays for a 24x7 stream. The plays metric for a 24x7 stream includes the first play as well as subsequent plays before the user ends the session.

metrics.name: Startup Errors
metrics.description: Total number of plays that did not start due to errors.

metrics.name: Plays Abandoned
metrics.description: Total number of plays that did not reach 95% of content playback.

metrics.name: Play Duration
metrics.description: Sum of actual playback time across all plays. This excludes ad play duration, forwards, rewinds, repeat playback, and pauses.

metrics.name: % Plays Abandoned
metrics.description: Percentage of plays that were abandoned before reaching 95% of content playback.

metrics.name: Daily Viewers (Title/Event Name)
metrics.description: Sum of unique viewers for a single title or event in a day.

metrics.name: Viewer (Daily)
metrics.description: Total number of unique viewers for a given day.

metrics.name: Visits per Viewer
metrics.description: Total number of visits to the media divided by the number of viewers

metrics.name: Plays per Viewer
metrics.description: Total number of plays divided by the number of viewers.

metrics.name: New Viewers
metrics.description: Total number of fresh viewers that have not viewed any content for a 13-month duration after report pack configuration, or prior to viewing the current play.

metrics.name: Visits Ended
metrics.description: Total number of visits to the media that ended. This number may not match with the number of `Visits` as a result of cases such as complete loss of network connectivity during a visit, thus preventing Media Analytics from receiving `Visit End` beacons.

metrics.name: Rebuffer Time per Minute
metrics.description: Time spent rebuffering per minute of playback.

metrics.name: Attempts
metrics.description: Total number of attempts to play content.

metrics.name: Rebuffers per Minute
metrics.description: Total number of rebuffers for all plays per minute of playback.

metrics.name: Plays
metrics.description: Number of attempts to play content that resulted in successful playback.

metrics.name: Startup Abandons
metrics.description: Sum of plays abandoned before the initial buffer filling. Abandons can also occur as a result of user-initiated actions, and not wholly due to systemic or stream startup failures.
